flawed_nl_solution:
If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=43>>43
Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.
Richard will be 40+43 = <<40+43=83>>83 years forty years from now.
Their combined ages forty years from now will be 83+54 = <<83+54=137>>137 years
#### 137

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 34, not 43. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
